title: Chesapeake Bay: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth         A Chesapeake Youth Corps crew from NPS partner Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation poses at the gates of their work site at Caledon State Park. Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation  The Chesapeake Bay is a great place to be a kid -- no matter what age you are! At ages 14 to 25, you can become involved in Youth Programs with the National Park Service Chesapeake Youth Corps partnership network.  At ages 4 to 12, you can become a Junior Ranger for the Captain John Smith Chesapeake National Historic Trail. You can play interactive games and take a trip with Captain John Smith or discover the Chesapeake with puzzles, games, and coloring books.
